dcterms:creator: Volodymyr Mnih
Adria Puigdomenech Badia
Mehdi Mirza
Alex Graves
Timothy Lillicrap
Tim Harley
David Silver
Koray Kavukcuoglu
dcterms:description: The A3C dataset is used for asynchronous parallel reinforcement learning, where a master-worker configuration allows a central node to communicate with other nodes, facilitating the learning process in a distributed manner.
dcterms:title: A3C

dcterms:creator: Richard S Sutton
Andrew G Barto
dcterms:description: The Mountaincar dataset is a classic reinforcement learning problem where an agent must learn to drive a car up a hill, requiring it to build momentum to reach the goal.
dcterms:title: Mountaincar

dcterms:creator: Guannan Qu
Yiheng Lin
Adam Wierman
Na Li
dcterms:description: The MARL dataset focuses on multi-agent reinforcement learning scenarios, where multiple agents learn to optimize their policies in a collaborative or competitive environment.
dcterms:title: MARL (Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning)

dcterms:creator: Lucas Cassano
Kun Yuan
Ali H Sayed
dcterms:description: The FDPE dataset is used for fully decentralized value function learning in multi-agent systems, focusing on achieving linear convergence rates.
dcterms:title: FDPE

dcterms:creator: Hoi-To Wai
Zhuoran Yang
Princeton Zhaoran Wang
Mingyi Hong
dcterms:description: The PD-DistIAG dataset is utilized for multi-agent reinforcement learning via double averaging primal-dual optimization, focusing on improving learning efficiency in distributed settings.
dcterms:title: PD-DistIAG
